comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: He was head of the The American Association (AA) of baseball. Allen W. Thurman, who is acting the part of the mediator in the baseball conference, left for Columbus, his home, last night. He will return next week to preside at the meeting to be held in this city. It was learned yesterday that Mr. Thurman was elected Chairman and Charles H. Byrne Secretary of the conference committee. Source: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9D0DE0DE113BE533A... According to ALLAN W. THURMAN, President of the Ohio Board of Administration, unless that State takes prompt measures to stop the production of imbeciles, within ten years it will be bankrupted by the cost of maintaining this part of its population. Source:http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9905EED6123CE633A25755C2A96F9C946396D6CF Date: September 26, 1912 I started a Wikipedia entry for him: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allan_W._Thurman

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: that article was from 1890, but most of these photos are from 1910-1915.  Might be a different guy.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Richard Arthur Norton and Harry Angstrom: Thanks for the comments!   I didn't find any other images of Mr. Thurman in our holdings to use for reference, so without something more definitive, we can stick with the existing caption for the time being.
